entry.et: Middle English sodain, from Anglo-French sudain, from Latin subitaneus, from subitus sudden, from past participle of subire to come up, from sub- up + ire to go sub-, issue

def.dt: :happening or coming unexpectedly a sudden shower
:changing angle or character all at once a sudden drop in the ocean bottom
:marked by or manifesting abruptness or haste a sudden departure
:made or brought about in a short time :prompt
:unexpected death that is instantaneous or occurs within minutes from any cause other than violence sudden death following coronary occlusion
:extra play to break a tie in a sports contest in which the first to score or gain the lead wins
:death of an apparently healthy infant usually before one year of age that is of unknown cause and occurs especially during sleep abbreviation SIDS called also crib death
